articles.description: NBA Hall of Famer Dikembe Mutombo dies from brain cancer at the age of 58.
articles.title: Dikembe Mutombo: NBA legend dies from brain cancer aged 58

articles.description: Erik ten Hag will remain in charge for Manchester United's fixtures against Porto and Aston Villa this week.
articles.title: Manchester United to stick with Erik ten Hag for Porto and Aston Villa matches

articles.description: France forward Antoine Griezmann announces his retirement from international football at the age of 33.
articles.title: Antoine Griezmann: France forward retires from internationals at 33

articles.description: India blitz a number of batting records on the fourth day of the rain-hit fourth Test against Bangladesh in Kanpur.
articles.title: India vs Bangladesh: Jaiswal, Kohli and Rahul star as hosts break records

articles.description: Jon Rahm’s play-off defeat in the Spanish Open by the world number 398 shows golf’s enduring capacity to yield upsets - but this trait rarely extends to the Presidents Cup, writes Iain Carter.
articles.title: Jon Rahm's Ryder Cup reminder as US warm up with Presidents Cup stroll

articles.description: Samuel Eto'o is banned from attending Cameroon games at all levels for six months following breaches of Fifa's disciplinary code by the country's federation president.
articles.title: Samuel Eto'o banned from attending Cameroon games for six months

articles.description: Patrick Mahomes wins on his 100th regular season start to set another record in the NFL, while Jayden Daniels continues historic start with Washington.
articles.title: NFL Results & Week 4 recap: Chiefs' Patrick Mahomes wins 100th game, Jayden Daniels' record start

articles.description: Ireland lock Dorothy Wall describes the shock 29-27 WXV1 win over world champions New Zealand as "just mad" as their rejuvenation continues.
articles.title: Ireland 29-27 New Zealand: 'Crazy where we've come in two years' - Dorothy Wall

articles.description: Trying to find the balance between pure engineering and entertainment has been a very difficult balancing act over the years in Formula 1, but many in the sport think we seeing the signs of change as the cost cap takes effect on track.
articles.title: Formula 1 in 10 years: Is the cost cap leading to better racing?

articles.description: Sonay Kartal feared she would not play again in 2024 because of a health issue. Now she is celebrating the best season of her life.
articles.title: Sonay Kartal: British player discusses first WTA title, Wimbledon and health scare
